msg: Greetings, stranger. You look like you have travelled a great distance to get here.

replies.msg: Hold on there... this is a cyberpunk game, not a fantasy game. You should've called me "chummer" or something.

destination.msg: Fair enough. Yolo, chummer. I can see you've been hacking the intertubes for gigaparsecs.

replies.msg: Much better, thank you. Now can you explain what all of this is about?

destination.msg: This is a tech demo using the Kengi engine.
I am a mysterious stranger... I could be anyone, or anything, you want me to be. The only limit is your imagination.

replies.msg: Sounds like you are the beginnings of a generic NPC class, designed to be flexible yet powerful.

destination.msg: Actually I'm just a generic isometric map object right now. But yeah, that is pretty flexible and powerful.
That's the spirit. Keep that in mind until the inventory system and combat get worked out.

replies.msg: Well, it was nice talking to you. I'll see you around.

destination.msg: Of course you will. I'm the only entity besides you on this map.
I could be a dog, a character, a computer terminal. Anything you need for the game.
[You stand before a friendly-looking samoyed dog. For some reason it is wearing a wizard robe and had glowing eyes.]
Achievement unlocked: It is possible to pet the dog in the Kengi demo!
Well, that's the point. This code is just a starting point; bricks from which games can be created.
